TaskDescription.Detail: Launch the calculator app and get the area of ​​a circle.

Assist.value: Ask the user to enter the radius of the circle.
Specify a variable to store the value entered by the user. Type this.userValue.
Enter a guide message as below. 'Enter the radius of the circle.'
Convert a string type variable into a number type variable.
Specify a variable to store the converted number. Type this.radius.
Specify the string to be converted. Type this.userValue.
Select Number.
Select toNumber.
Launch the calculator app.
Enter the command of the calculator execution. Type 'calc.exe'.
You may specify the name of the derived app. Type null.
Click Run below to launch the calculator.
Click the 'Open Navigation' button.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the 'Open Navigation' button.
Click the 'Scientific' button.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the 'Scientific' button.
Set the value to be input in the calculator.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the input space of the calculator.
Specify a variable to be input. Type this.radius.
Square the input value.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the 'Square' button.
Apply multiplication.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the 'Multiply by' button.
Multiply pi.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the 'Pi' button.
Get the result of the calculation.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the 'Equals' button.
Copy the result and save it to the clipboard.
Store the value stored in the clipboard in a variable.
Specify a variable to store the value. Type this.circleArea.
Print the calculation result in a message box.
Specify a variable to be printed. Type this.circleArea.
